content.raw:
We could write an extra pair of functions (similar to the [msgs::ConvertJointType](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/9a82e56499a34b0faa5d6fd1ba980556b3a70e5d/gazebo/msgs/msgs.hh#cl-119) functions):

* private: int ConvertFrictionModel(string)
* private: string ConvertFrictionModel(int)

I like using strings for the public interface:

* public: string GetFrictionModel()
* public: bool SetFrictionModel(string)

I think we can implement `GetFrictionModel` using `dWorldGetQuickStepFrictionModel` without changing sdformat.
content.html:
We could write an extra pair of functions (similar to the msgs::ConvertJointType functions):

  • private: int ConvertFrictionModel(string)
  • private: string ConvertFrictionModel(int)

I like using strings for the public interface:

  • public: string GetFrictionModel()
  • public: bool SetFrictionModel(string)

I think we can implement GetFrictionModel using dWorldGetQuickStepFrictionModel without changing sdformat.

content.raw:
I pulled in your branch to osrf/gazebo and made two changes:

* d83393d2882a: skip the `MaximumDissipation` test for non-ODE engines. Currently it is running the test 4 times for ODE.
* 772739398c92: merged with default to resolve conflicts 

Can you pull this to your fork?
content.html:
I pulled in your branch to osrf/gazebo and made two changes:

  • d83393d2882a: skip the MaximumDissipation test for non-ODE engines. Currently it is running the test 4 times for ODE.
  • 772739398c92: merged with default to resolve conflicts

Can you pull this to your fork?

update.description:
To enable  the cone friction model, define the macro `USE_FRICTION_CONE` [here](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/582c40022b3d5b6ee10b095e79ac841bea2958ed/deps/opende/src/quickstep_util.h?at=cone_friction#cl-57). Comment this line to stick with ODE's pyramid friction model. 

Maximum dissipation tests added [here](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/582c40022b3d5b6ee10b095e79ac841bea2958ed/test/integration/physics_friction.cc?at=cone_friction#cl-302).  To test the cone friction model, run this command: 

`./build_isolated/gazebo/devel/test/integration/INTEGRATION_physics_friction --gtest_filter="*Dissipation/0" `

[issue 1515](#!/osrf/gazebo/issue/1515/j_orig-not-correct-inside-ode-quickstep) is fixed [here](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/582c40022b3d5b6ee10b095e79ac841bea2958ed/deps/opende/src/quickstep.cpp?at=cone_friction#cl-378)
update.title: cone friction model

content.raw:
parameter sounds good. [An example for parallel position correction calculation](#!/osrf/gazebo/commits/98d1db76b0f94bc6a6b99e6ef5d7c56cedc7a3fc).  Touches following places:

  - [smooth_contacts parameter](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/0e2207f8d14992552786558471494e5bc20569bb/deps/opende/src/objects.h?at=default#cl-120)
  - [initialize smooth_contacts parameter](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/0e2207f8d14992552786558471494e5bc20569bb/deps/opende/src/ode.cpp?at=default#cl-1689)
  - [dWorldGetQuickStepContactResidualSmoothing](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/0e2207f8d14992552786558471494e5bc20569bb/deps/opende/src/ode.cpp?at=default#cl-2302)
  - [dWorldSetQuickStepContactResidualSmoothing](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/0e2207f8d14992552786558471494e5bc20569bb/deps/opende/src/ode.cpp?at=default#cl-2332)
  - [include/ode/objects.h Get](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/0e2207f8d14992552786558471494e5bc20569bb/deps/opende/include/ode/objects.h?at=default#cl-549)
  - [include/ode/objects.h Set](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/0e2207f8d14992552786558471494e5bc20569bb/deps/opende/include/ode/objects.h?at=default#cl-581)
  - [Get/Set in include/ode/odecpp.h](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/0e2207f8d14992552786558471494e5bc20569bb/deps/opende/include/ode/odecpp.h?at=default#cl-119)
 
is that what you mean (@scpeters)?
content.html:
parameter sounds good. An example for parallel position correction calculation. Touches following places:

  • smooth_contacts parameter
  • initialize smooth_contacts parameter
  • dWorldGetQuickStepContactResidualSmoothing
  • dWorldSetQuickStepContactResidualSmoothing
  • include/ode/objects.h Get
  • include/ode/objects.h Set
  • Get/Set in include/ode/odecpp.h

is that what you mean (@scpeters)?

`INTEGRATION_physics_friction` also fails for me. Here is a short snippet.


```
#!c++

[ RUN      ] PhysicsEngines/PhysicsFrictionTest.FrictionDemo/0
/data/gazebo_pr_1522/test/integration/physics_friction.cc:286: Failure
The difference between vel.y and (g.y + box->friction) * t.Double() is 0.001169343486147404, which exceeds g_friction_tolerance, where
vel.y evaluates to -0.0014193434861473765,
(g.y + box->friction) * t.Double() evaluates to -0.00024999999999997247, and
g_friction_tolerance evaluates to 0.001.
/data/gazebo_pr_1522/test/integration/physics_friction.cc:279: Failure
The difference between vel.y and 0 is 0.0010057863217582351, which exceeds g_friction_tolerance, where
vel.y evaluates to -0.0010057863217582351,
0 evaluates to 0, and
g_friction_tolerance evaluates to 0.001.

```

content.raw:
Friction model is set as 'cone friction' [here](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1522/cone-friction-model/diff#Ldeps/opende/src/ode.cppT1693), 
so most of the tests might fail, if the tests were run as box friction, or the two friction parameters are not equal
content.html: Friction model is set as 'cone friction' here, so most of the tests might fail, if the tests were run as box friction, or the two friction parameters are not equal

content.raw: [jenkins build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-external-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/35)
content.html: jenkins build

content.raw:
[3cdc039](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/commits/3cdc039302c3b2cb6526741ad6792ef6a63ec7cd?at=default) has set `friction_model` as a parameter. 
Another commit would be on the function pointer for different friction models inside ODE, without breaking the Gazebo interface.
content.html: 3cdc039 has set friction_model as a parameter. Another commit would be on the function pointer for different friction models inside ODE, without breaking the Gazebo interface.

update.description:
To enable  the cone friction model, define the macro `USE_FRICTION_CONE` [here](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/582c40022b3d5b6ee10b095e79ac841bea2958ed/deps/opende/src/quickstep_util.h?at=cone_friction#cl-57). Comment this line to stick with ODE's pyramid friction model. 

Maximum dissipation tests added [here](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/582c40022b3d5b6ee10b095e79ac841bea2958ed/test/integration/physics_friction.cc?at=cone_friction#cl-302).  To test the cone friction model, run this command: 

`./build_isolated/gazebo/devel/test/integration/INTEGRATION_physics_friction --gtest_filter="*Dissipation/0" `

[issue 1515](#!/osrf/gazebo/issue/1515/j_orig-not-correct-inside-ode-quickstep) is fixed [here](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/582c40022b3d5b6ee10b095e79ac841bea2958ed/deps/opende/src/quickstep.cpp?at=cone_friction#cl-378)
update.title: cone friction model

update.description:
To enable  the cone friction model, define the macro `USE_FRICTION_CONE` [here](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/582c40022b3d5b6ee10b095e79ac841bea2958ed/deps/opende/src/quickstep_util.h?at=cone_friction#cl-57). Comment this line to stick with ODE's pyramid friction model. 

Maximum dissipation tests added [here](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/582c40022b3d5b6ee10b095e79ac841bea2958ed/test/integration/physics_friction.cc?at=cone_friction#cl-302).  To test the cone friction model, run this command: 

`./build_isolated/gazebo/devel/test/integration/INTEGRATION_physics_friction --gtest_filter="*Dissipation/0" `

[issue 1515](#!/osrf/gazebo/issue/1515/j_orig-not-correct-inside-ode-quickstep) is fixed [here](https://bitbucket.org/rosebudflyaway/gazebo/src/582c40022b3d5b6ee10b095e79ac841bea2958ed/deps/opende/src/quickstep.cpp?at=cone_friction#cl-378)
update.title: cone friction model

content.raw: sure
content.html: sure

content.raw: sounds good, worth exploring. Especially if it allows users to provide customized friction models in the future.
content.html: sounds good, worth exploring. Especially if it allows users to provide customized friction models in the future.

content.raw:
This is a good idea. I will follow the solver function pointer way, spend
some time and make it more extendable.
In this way, we would have to add two functions to the ODE quickstep.cpp.
for the box friction and cone friction.
Is that OK?
content.html: This is a good idea. I will follow the solver function pointer way, spend some time and make it more extendable. In this way, we would have to add two functions to the ODE quickstep.cpp. for the box friction and cone friction. Is that OK?

content.raw:
The `ODEPhysics` class stores a function pointer based on which solver it is going to use. Perhaps we could do the same here? Put each friction model into a function and store a function pointer? This would allow other friction models in the future. This is just an idea; it may be hard to implement.

Another alternative to `bool` is an `enum`.
content.html:
The ODEPhysics class stores a function pointer based on which solver it is going to use. Perhaps we could do the same here? Put each friction model into a function and store a function pointer? This would allow other friction models in the future. This is just an idea; it may be hard to implement.

Another alternative to bool is an enum.

content.raw: maybe add one more `bool` parameter `USE_FRICTION_CONE` [here](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/0e2207f8d14992552786558471494e5bc20569bb/deps/opende/src/objects.h?at=default#cl-120). Basically we have two friction models for now. Would we have a 3rd one?
content.html: maybe add one more bool parameter USE_FRICTION_CONE here. Basically we have two friction models for now. Would we have a 3rd one?

content.raw: One test is barely failing; I would propose changing the tolerance, but we should do that after creating a parameter for the friction model to be used, and then make sure the test runs against both friction models.
content.html: One test is barely failing; I would propose changing the tolerance, but we should do that after creating a parameter for the friction model to be used, and then make sure the test runs against both friction models.

content.raw: Yep, so in order to use the cone friction model, we should guarantee the hi[index] = lo[index], which is the primary frictional coefficient = secondary frictional coefficient
content.html: Yep, so in order to use the cone friction model, we should guarantee the hi[index] = lo[index], which is the primary frictional coefficient = secondary frictional coefficient

content.raw: Does `hi[index]` represent the friction coefficient `mu`?
content.html: Does hi[index] represent the friction coefficient mu?

content.raw: I think it would be better to make the friction model a parameter rather than a macro. How should that be implemented @hsu ?
content.html: I think it would be better to make the friction model a parameter rather than a macro. How should that be implemented @hsu ?
